---
title: Sign the Transfer Transaction
slug: /guides/staking-api/polkadot/transfer/sign-transfer-transaction
---

Sign the transfer transaction using the `transaction_payload` you received in response to submitting the transfer data.

Locate the `transaction_payload` in the response from the previous step. It will look something like this:

```json
"transaction_payload": ""
```

:::caution important

Always confirm the details of the transaction before signing the payload.

Figment has a tool for signing and decoding Staking API payloads, see the guide [Signing Transactions with Figment's npm Package](/guides/staking-api/figment-signing-transactions) to continue.

:::

Transactions can also be signed using the [PolkadotJS Tools](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/build-transaction-construction) or [Fireblocks](/guides/staking-api/fireblocks-signing-transactions).

Sign the transaction and move on to the next step. A signed transaction payload for Polkadot will look something like this:

```text
0x3d028400c03f2415e59cb6f46d85837762060744fdc67e71dce6426b0ef3347c6f3ac25301c8fabe0ccafba4725082416d985669e9eff5b8eb96a5829727ea8f3ab5f21d28dfed7582018b7c17b51a5281e3c27cf23bc8dee002a43ece83ad1efe6ddc7d8d000800040000beaa875b14abaeae2d1a55193ba6f175aa846b7e624dce1514fbf043638aa858070010a5d4e8
```
